trans-unit.source: Directs an existing browser window to navigate to the specified URL

seg-source.mrk: Directs an existing browser window to navigate to the specified URL

target.mrk: Directs an existing browser window to navigate to the specified URL

trans-unit.source: Object variable of an InternetExplorer.Application, Window or Frame object
[optional] specifies whether to wait for page to load before returning

seg-source.mrk: specifies whether to wait for page to load before returning

target.mrk: specifies whether to wait for page to load before returning

trans-unit.source: 0 = Return immediately, not waiting for page to load

seg-source.mrk: 0 = Return immediately, not waiting for page to load

target.mrk: 0 = Return immediately, not waiting for page to load

trans-unit.source: 1 = (Default) Wait for page load to complete before returning

seg-source.mrk: 1 = (Default) Wait for page load to complete before returning

target.mrk: 1 = (Default) Wait for page load to complete before returning

trans-unit.source: 0 or -1 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 or -1 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 or -1 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: This function always returns a value of -1.

seg-source.mrk: This function always returns a value of -1.

target.mrk: This function always returns a value of -1.

trans-unit.source: This is because the navigate method has no useful return value and therefore nothing can be implied from it.

seg-source.mrk: This is because the navigate method has no useful return value and therefore nothing can be implied from it.

target.mrk: This is because the navigate method has no useful return value and therefore nothing can be implied from it.

trans-unit.source: You will need to employ other methods to determine success or failure of the navigation.

seg-source.mrk: You will need to employ other methods to determine success or failure of the navigation.

target.mrk: You will need to employ other methods to determine success or failure of the navigation.

trans-unit.source: New security in Windows Vista causes a new browser window to be created when a browser is instructed to navigate to a URL in a different security zone.

seg-source.mrk: New security in Windows Vista causes a new browser window to be created when a browser is instructed to navigate to a URL in a different security zone.

target.mrk: New security in Windows Vista causes a new browser window to be created when a browser is instructed to navigate to a URL in a different security zone.

trans-unit.source: This occurs as well with the initial creation and navigation initiated with _IECreate(). The new window is a new browser instance and the previous browser object variable no longer points to it.

seg-source.mrk: This occurs as well with the initial creation and navigation initiated with _IECreate().
The new window is a new browser instance and the previous browser object variable no longer points to it.

target.mrk: This occurs as well with the initial creation and navigation initiated with _IECreate().
The new window is a new browser instance and the previous browser object variable no longer points to it.

trans-unit.source: 1) add #RequireAdmin to your code (this is required even if the account is part of the Administrator's Group and will prompt for credentials if necessary),

seg-source.mrk: 1) add #RequireAdmin to your code (this is required even if the account is part of the Administrator's Group and will prompt for credentials if necessary),

target.mrk: 1) add #RequireAdmin to your code (this is required even if the account is part of the Administrator's Group and will prompt for credentials if necessary),

trans-unit.source: 2) use _IEAttach() to connect to the new browser window

seg-source.mrk: 2) use _IEAttach() to connect to the new browser window

target.mrk: 2) use _IEAttach() to connect to the new browser window

trans-unit.source: 3) add the target website to the Trusted Sites security zone in IE,

seg-source.mrk: 3) add the target website to the Trusted Sites security zone in IE,

target.mrk: 3) add the target website to the Trusted Sites security zone in IE,

trans-unit.source: or 5) disable UAC. Care must be taken to understand the implications of disabling IE security features when accessing untrusted sites.

seg-source.mrk: Care must be taken to understand the implications of disabling IE security features when accessing untrusted sites.

target.mrk: Care must be taken to understand the implications of disabling IE security features when accessing untrusted sites.
